bug.short_desc: Missing source code in the GMF 2.0.2 SDK

long_desc.thetext:
The GMF 2.1 M4 SDK is missing the source for several bundles:
org.eclipse.gmf.runtime.common.core org.eclipse.gmf.runtime.common.ui.services org.eclipse.gmf.runtime.diagram.ui.geoshapes org.eclipse.gmf.runtime.diagram.ui.properties org.eclipse.gmf.runtime.diagram.ui.providers.ide org.eclipse.gmf.runtime.draw2d.ui.render org.eclipse.gmf.runtime.emf.core org.eclipse.gmf.runtime.emf.ui.properties org.eclipse.gmf.runtime.notation org.eclipse.gmf.runtime.notation.providers etc.
I initially thought as I was typing this that it was a regression from GMF 2.1 M3 SDK, but M3 is also missing bundles
There are 38 runtime bundles in the SDK ( same as in the 3.3.1 SDK ). There are 29 in M3 There are 23 in M4 There are 23 in N20080109

There is also source code missing from the Maintenance builds
For example, M20071127 only has 20 src.zip.
The GMF 2.0.1 build from September is fine. M20071127 is the only maintenance build since GMF 2.0.1.

Perhaps it's time to move to the new way of producing source bundles?
http://wiki.eclipse.org/PDEBuild/Individual_Source_Bundles

Looks like the change happened in November in between 31 Oct 2007 and 20 Nov 2007.
N20080109 - 23 N20071129 - 25 N20071120 - 25 N20071031 - 38 bundles ok
No recent changes have been made to the features that I can see.

(In reply to comment #2) > Perhaps it's time to move to the new way of producing source bundles? > > http://wiki.eclipse.org/PDEBuild/Individual_Source_Bundles >
This will not help the maintenance stream.
We are down to 21 out of 38 in maintenance build M20080114.
Moving back to 2.0.2 since this affects the maintenance release.
Confirmed 38 src.zip in M20080201 and I20080201.
[GMF Restructure] Bug 319140 : product GMF and component Releng was the original product and component for this bug
